s.text: (The paper waits until the tenth and last paragraph of the story to reveal that the poll sample was but 1,004 adults.)

The LAT and USAT fronts run stories about the arrest for spying of a former Army sergeant who served as a codebreaker, allegedly for selling (for $60,000) the identity of Soviet sites to be nuked by the U.S. if the Soviet Union started a nuclear war.
The other key element, reported high by the NYT and the main thrust of the LAT lead, is Milosevic's commitment Tuesday to local elections for Kosovo.

If the detail about the inspectors seems familiar, that's because yesterday's USAT and LAT said they'd been agreed to, whereas yesterday's NYT said merely that Milosevic appeared ready to accept a monitoring force.
